title: Sonoma Valley
name: Jack London State Historic Park
content: This park is the historic home of American author, Jack London, and his wife Chariman. They lived here for the last years of both of their lives. London built his dream home, Beauty Ranch, and before it was finished it burned tragically, destroyed the property. He died soon thereafter, and Chariman lived there until her own death. They are buried on the property. The park has amazing hiking, wildlife, birding and in the summer time, live music events.
